moves.1. e4:
That One Move. 

Here was a game I'd fought well, made a mistake and managed to extricate myself and then one move killed me. The type of game you are left thinking how did I lose that?
moves.4. d3 Nc6 5. Bg5 O-O 6. Nd5 Be7 7. Bxf6: Speculative, no real plan in mind.
moves.13. Kb1 d6 14. g3 Qh6 15. Qf1 f5: Trying to open up the f file for attacks.
moves.16. Qg2 fxe4 17. dxe4 Qh5 18. Nh4 Bd7: Sloppy move, didn't think about defence.
moves.19. Rxd6 Rad8 20. Qf1 Bc8 21. Rxd8 Rxd8: Grabbed the pawn back, but knew from similar situations before I was going to have to work to extricate myself.
moves.24. Ne3 Qh5: Going along the bishop diagonal would have brought g4, cutting the bishop off from retreat.
moves.25. g4 Qh4 26. Nf5: My opponent continues to harass, but does what I do, forgetting about defence.
So now two pawns up and feeling really good.
moves.30. Qc3 Kf7 31. Qb3+: Until that happens. Now I can see it coming. qxp...queen and rook threatening g pawn.
moves.31... Kf8 32. Qxb7: But all the responses I can think of are blocked because of the 'lowly' knight which is just in the wrong spot.....
